intro: Lasiochlamys, commonly known as the silky thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its woolly, silver-gray leaves and showy purple or pink flowers. The plant is native to various regions in Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. Lasiochlamys species often grow in dry, rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are often used in herbal medicine for their potential health benefits.
